page.title: 05Tourism in Papa Westray
page.content: In the 1980's tourism began to play an important part in the economy of the island. The population was no longer sufficient to support a shop. To counteract this the islanders with the help of the H.I.D.B. set up a community cooperative whose initial remit was to provide a shop and make it viable by providing hostel and guest house facilities for Tourists. This they proceeded to do and employed a husband and wife team to manage a general store with agriculture supplies and fuels together with a 16 bedded hostel and a 4 roomed guest house. The public rooms have been designed in such a way that they can be used for community activities during the winter months. Up to 1985 the number of tourists has increased each year.
